snippet: In the name of fighting health reform, a growing number of states are ignoring their obligations to the neediest citizens.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Texas Gov Rick Perry for promising to refuse Medicaid money from the federal government, part of the health care reform law, even while Texas has the country's worst health care record; notes at least five other Republican governors have made a similar choice, and says their refusal illuminates a growing divide over role of state government; urges the governors to accept the Medicaid money, for the sake of their neediest citizens.
lead_paragraph: In the name of fighting health reform, a growing number of states are ignoring their obligations to the neediest citizens.
